oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of a Novel Taxa-Oxa-Sugar Hybrid Core Structure by Tandem Cross-Enyne Metathesis/IMDA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NANDURDIKAR, RS
SUBRAHMANYAM, AV
KALIAPPAN, KP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ring-closing-metathesis

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes our design and efforts in synthesizing new scaffolds with taxol-eleutherobin hybrid core structures and a taxol-sugar hybrid. The synthesis of taxol-eleutherobin hybrids involved the synthesis of the A-ring fragment from carvone and the C-ring fragment from either D-mannose or D-glucose. The Shapiro reaction was used as the key reaction to couple the A- and C-ring fragments of these hybrid structures. Unfortunately, another key reaction (RCM) failed to form the B-ring and essentially the core unit. However, a tandem enyne cross-metathesis/intramolecular Diels-Alder strategy was utilized for the synthesis of a taxa-oxa-sugar hybrid.
